title: Filesystem Configuration
description: CIS Ubuntu Linux 24.04 LTS Benchmark - Section 1.1: Filesystem Configuration

controls.title: Ensure cramfs kernel module is not available
controls.description: The cramfs filesystem type is a compressed read-only Linux filesystem embedded in small footprint systems.
controls.impact: Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface of the system.
controls.remediation: Edit or create a file in the /etc/modprobe.d/ directory ending in .conf and add: install cramfs /bin/true

controls.title: Ensure freevxfs kernel module is not available
controls.description: The freevxfs filesystem type is a free version of the Veritas type filesystem.
controls.impact: Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface of the system.
controls.remediation: Edit or create a file in the /etc/modprobe.d/ directory ending in .conf and add: install freevxfs /bin/true

controls.title: Ensure hfs kernel module is not available

controls.title: Ensure udf kernel module is not available
controls.description: The udf filesystem type is the universal disk format used to implement ISO/IEC 13346 and ECMA-167 specifications.
controls.impact: Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface of the system.

controls.title: Ensure usb-storage kernel module is not available
controls.description: USB storage provides a means to transfer and store files insecurely on a system.
controls.impact: Restricting USB storage will decrease the likelihood of malicious software being introduced to the system.
controls.remediation: Edit or create a file in the /etc/modprobe.d/ directory ending in .conf and add: install usb-storage /bin/true

controls.title: Ensure unused filesystems kernel modules are not available
controls.description: This control addresses any additional filesystem kernel modules that are not covered by the previous controls.
controls.impact: Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface of the system.
controls.remediation: Identify and disable any additional unused filesystem kernel modules according to organizational policy.
controls.expected: Review and disable unused filesystem kernel modules

controls.title: Ensure /tmp is a separate partition
controls.description: The /tmp directory is a world-writable directory used for temporary storage by all users and some applications.
controls.impact: Making /tmp its own file system allows an administrator to set mount options for enhanced security.
controls.remediation: Configure /tmp as a separate partition or logical volume.

controls.title: Ensure nodev option set on /tmp partition
controls.description: The nodev mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain special devices.
controls.impact: Since the /tmp filesystem is not intended to support devices, set this option to ensure that users cannot attempt to create block or character special devices.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nodev to the fourth field (mounting options) for the /tmp partition.

controls.title: Ensure nosuid option set on /tmp partition
controls.description: The nosuid mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain setuid files.
controls.impact: Since the /tmp filesystem is only intended for temporary file storage, set this option to ensure that users cannot create setuid files.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nosuid to the fourth field (mounting options) for the /tmp partition.

controls.title: Ensure noexec option set on /tmp partition
controls.description: The noexec mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain executable binaries.
controls.impact: Since the /tmp filesystem is only intended for temporary file storage, set this option to ensure that users cannot run executable binaries from /tmp.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add noexec to the fourth field (mounting options) for the /tmp partition.
